It keeps crashing everytime I boot it up. I have changed the compatibility mode to Windows 98. I'm running Windows 7 64 bit but I still can't get it to work. Any help?

I use windows 7 64 bit too and it runs perfectly on mine. try updating ur direct x if possible there is no need to run in compatibility mode. just make sure you have clicked the setup file. if you clicked setup and moved the folder to another location that might have screwed it up try clicking that set up file again
Thanks for the response but it still is not working. After I join the files. I click setup but it does nothing. If I right click it and open it it will crash windows explorer.
this might be a silly thing to ask but have u extracted the game from the zip folder. if you try to run the game in the zip folder it will crash you need to extract it
Yeah I have. Right after I click the GTA application my screen changes and I have to start task manager to close it because it is not responding.

I found the problem. I had to manually create some folders and extract the files to there. Create:

C:Program FilesRockstar GamesGTAIII then extract all the files there and you should be good to go!
cool good you sorted it ^^
Why i cant change the resolution?
yes you can just go into display settings. if its set to the lowest just change it. If you cant i suggest you update ur graphics driver and or direct X
and make sure you press (return enter button) once you change it

n00bzey22 Thanks for linking the pictures . The only thing i can think of is that your Direct X isn't up to-date or you don't have the up to-date driver for your gfx card 

Here is the official updater for direct X 
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35

as for your gfx card you will need to find that your self.

AS for changing the resolution thats easy just to into display setting and use your wheel on your mouse to change it to the desired dimensions and press the return enter button.

I hope this helps in any way
